It was initially created to be able to easily backup or create a distributable copy of an Ubuntu or derivative installation. Inspiration for this tool came from the <tt>[[mklivecd]]</tt> script that Mandriva uses and the <tt>remasterme</tt> script that is in [[PCLinuxOS]]. Since those scripts are not very easy to port to ubuntu, it was created from scratch. <br> It is very useful and easy way to create a customized Live CD/DVD version of Ubuntu, once the system is installed, and configured with programs, updates, etc... the user just as to:
  +
#download and install the latest version of remastersys from: http://remastersys.klikit-linux.com/repository/remastersys/
  +
#Open the program (a shortcut is created in the desktop) and then choose the <tt>dist</tt> or <tt>backup</tt> option, and then the iso of the LiveCD will be automaticaly created.
  +
The resulting [[ISO_image|iso]] can also the later installed in a USB pendrive, creating a [[Live_USB|LiveUSB]] distro.<ref>{{citeweb|title=USB Ubuntu 7.10 Gutsy Gibbon install|url=http://www.pendrivelinux.com/2007/09/28/usb-ubuntu-710-gutsy-gibbon-install/|publisher=pendrivelinux.com|accessdate=2008-03-21}}</ref>
It has a command line version and a [[GUI]] version. It currently works with [[Ubuntu_%28Linux_distribution%29|Ubuntu]], [[Linux_Mint|Linux Mint]] and Klikit-Linux, and possibly more ubuntu-based distributions.
